title: The Abominable Snowmen
dialogue_triumphs: Victoria, I think this is one of those instances where discretion is the better part of valour: Jamie has an idea.
'Have you thought up some clever plan, Doctor?' 'Yes, Jamie, I believe I have.' 'What are you going to do?' 'Bung a rock at it.'
goofs: Sapan, one of the monks, sounds Welsh.
In the first episode snow is seen on the TARDIS scanner: when the travellers emerge not a flake is visible.
Thomni on one occasion says that the holy ghanta has been missing for about 200 years when the figure should be about 300.
The TARDIS landing sound is slower than usual.

continuity_notes.name: The Great Intelligence
continuity_notes.description: A powerful alien force that strives for physical existence, first possessing Padmasambhava, and then seeking to dominate the Earth via the substance extruded from the pyramid of spheres in the cave.
continuity_notes.current_status: Attempting to gain physical form and dominate Earth

continuity_notes.name: Yeti
continuity_notes.description: Simple but strong robots, created by Padmasambhava over two centuries, and controlled by the Intelligence. Real Yeti are slimmer and nervous of humans.

continuity_notes.name: Padmasambhava
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's old friend, possessed by the Great Intelligence

continuity_notes.name: Holy Ghanta
continuity_notes.description: A sacred object from the Det Sen monastery, taken into safekeeping by the Doctor in 1630

roots: Nigel Kneale's The Creature (filmed as The Abominable Snowman)
In the Footsteps of the Abominable Snowman by Josef Nesvadba
The Tibetan Book of the Dead
links: Jamie thinks they've landed further down the mountain on Telos.

locations.name: Det Sen monastery
locations.description: A Tibetan Buddhist monastery where the story takes place
locations.current_status: Under threat from the Great Intelligence and Yeti

untold_adventures: The Doctor has been to Det Sen before, including a visit in 1630 when he took the holy ghanta into safekeeping.
The Doctor has had multiple visits to Det Sen, as he says 'Every time I visit Det Sen the monastery seems to be in some kind of trouble'
At least one visit to Det Sen must have taken place between 'The Power of the Daleks' and 'The Highlanders', indicating an extended series of adventures for Ben and Polly.
qv: See 'Full Circle' for more on the TARDIS scanner inconsistency.
'The Web of Fear' dates this story to 1935.
additional_notes: The Doctor plays 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star' on the recorder. Padmasambhava was the author of a Buddhist text about death being preferable to suffering.
bottom_line: A reasonable adventure with a hefty splash of 60s Buddhism, 'The Abominable Snowmen' is, beneath its Yeti trappings, an attempt to create an unusual monster. It's a shame the Yeti are so cute.
